verses.verse: The word <WH1697> which came to Jeremiah <WH3414> from Jehovah <WH3068>, saying <WH559>,

Then I went down <WH3381> to the potter <WH3335>'s house <WH1004>, and <WH2009>, behold, he was making <WH6213> a work <WH4399> on the wheels <WH70>.

And when the vessel <WH3627> that he made <WH6213> of the clay <WH2563> was marred <WH7843> in the hand <WH3027> of the potter <WH3335>, he made <WH6213> it again <WH7725> another <WH312> vessel <WH3627>, as seemed <WH5869> good <WH3474> to the potter <WH3335> to make it <WH6213>.

O house <WH1004> of Israel <WH3478>, cannot <WH3201> I do <WH6213> with you as this potter <WH3335>? saith <WH5002> Jehovah <WH3068>. Behold <WH2563>, as the clay in the potter <WH3335>'s hand <WH3027>, so are ye in my hand <WH3027>, O house <WH1004> of Israel <WH3478>.

if that nation <WH1471>, concerning which I have spoken <WH1696>, turn <WH7725> from their evil <WH7451>, I will repent <WH5162> of the evil <WH7451> that I thought <WH2803> to do unto them <WH6213>.

if they do <WH6213> that which is evil <WH7451> in my sight <WH5869>, that they obey <WH8085> not my voice <WH6963>, then I will repent <WH5162> of the good <WH2896>, wherewith I said <WH559> I would benefit them <WH3190>.

Now therefore <WH559>, speak to the men <WH376> of Judah <WH3063>, and to the inhabitants <WH3427> of Jerusalem <WH3389>, saying <WH559>, Thus saith <WH559> Jehovah <WH3068>: Behold <WH3335>, I frame evil <WH7451> against you <WH2803>, and devise a device <WH4284> against you <WH7725>: return ye now every one <WH376> from his evil <WH7451> way <WH1870>, and amend <WH3190> your ways <WH1870> and your doings <WH4611>.

But they say <WH559>, It is in vain <WH2976>; for we will walk <WH3212> after <WH310> our own devices <WH4284>, and we will do <WH6213> every one <WH376> after the stubbornness <WH8307> of his evil <WH7451> heart <WH3820>.

Therefore thus saith <WH559> Jehovah <WH3068>: Ask <WH7592> ye now among the nations <WH1471>, who hath heard <WH8085> such things <WH1330>; the virgin of Israel <WH3478> hath done <WH6213> a very <WH3966> horrible thing <WH8186>.

Shall the snow <WH7950> of Lebanon <WH3844> fail <WH5800> from the rock <WH6697> of the field <WH7704>? or shall the cold <WH7119> waters <WH4325> that flow <WH5140> down from afar <WH2114> be dried up <WH5428>?

For my people <WH5971> have forgotten <WH7911> me <WH6999>, they have burned incense to false <WH7723> gods <WH3782>; and they have been made to stumble in their ways <WH1870>, in the ancient <WH5769> paths <WH7635>, to walk <WH3212> in bypaths <WH5410>, in a way <WH1870> not cast up <WH5549>;

to make <WH7760> their land <WH776> an astonishment <WH8047>, and a perpetual <WH5769> hissing <WH8292>; every one that passeth <WH5674> thereby shall be astonished <WH8074>, and shake <WH5110> his head <WH7218>.

I will scatter <WH6327> them as with an east <WH6921> wind <WH7307> before <WH6440> the enemy <WH341>; I will show <WH7200> them the back <WH6203>, and not the face <WH6440>, in the day <WH3117> of their calamity <WH343>.

Then said <WH559> they <WH3212>, Come, and let us devise <WH2803> devices <WH4284> against Jeremiah <WH3414>; for the law <WH8451> shall not perish <WH6> from the priest <WH3548>, nor counsel <WH6098> from the wise <WH2450>, nor the word <WH1697> from the prophet <WH5030>. Come <WH3212>, and let us smite <WH5221> him with the tongue <WH3956>, and let us not give heed <WH7181> to any of his words <WH1697>.
Give heed <WH7181> to me <WH3068>, O Jehovah, and hearken <WH8085> to the voice <WH6963> of them that contend with me <WH3401>.

Shall evil <WH7451> be recompensed <WH7999> for good <WH2896>? for they have digged <WH3738> a pit <WH7745> for my soul <WH5315>. Remember <WH2142> how I stood <WH5975> before <WH6440> thee to speak <WH1696> good <WH2896> for them <WH7725>, to turn away thy wrath from them <WH2534>.

Therefore deliver up <WH5414> their children <WH1121> to the famine <WH7458>, and give them <WH5064> over to the power <WH3027> of the sword <WH2719>; and let their wives <WH802> become childless <WH7909>, and widows <WH490>; and let their men <WH582> be slain <WH4194> of death <WH4194>, and their young men <WH970> smitten <WH5221> of the sword <WH2719> in battle <WH4421>.

Let a cry <WH2201> be heard <WH8085> from their houses <WH1004>, when thou shalt bring <WH935> a troop <WH1416> suddenly <WH6597> upon them <WH3738>; for they have digged a pit <WH7745> to take <WH3920> me <WH2934>, and hid snares <WH6341> for my feet <WH7272>.

Yet <WH3068>, Jehovah, thou knowest <WH3045> all their counsel <WH6098> against me to slay <WH4194> me <WH3722>; forgive not their iniquity <WH5771>, neither blot out <WH4229> their sin <WH2403> from thy sight <WH6440>; but let them be overthrown <WH3782> before <WH6440> thee <WH6213>; deal thou with them in the time <WH6256> of thine anger <WH639>.
